title: Ticket #5842: Clarify coresize info in condor_submit man page
description:
From htcondor-support #8715:

On page 914 in the 8.5.6 manual, in the description for the coresize declaration in the condor_submit man page, there's a reference to "the system's user resource limit coredumpsize." I think it would be helpful to update this to clarify that this refers to the UNIX/Linux ulimit command, as opposed to some sort of HTCondor "resource" as in cpu, memory, disk, swap. This bit of knowledge might be lost on many consumers of the man page.
